talk.utter:
I think it's great if people want to block me. I wish more people would, in fact. If you don't want to interact with me, you shouldn't have to.

I hate the notion that every time I hit the "post" button, my goal is to reach the max number of people. It's bizarre and unhealthy.

talk.author: did:plc:efisyjhyaue4qplmoxtkizvn
talk.utter: Additionally, while necessary in some contexts for safety, I think blocking is part of the larger problem of digital gated communities becoming echo chambers and concentrating certain points of view. 2/2

talk.author: did:plc:psqralexigiufgtswkszy6zr
talk.utter:
Yeah there was a guy on the street yelling about how aliens were putting psychic lice in his corn flakes. If I don't want to be in an echo chamber I better stop and listen to him for an hour or two.

Echo chambers are literally how we maintain a healthy society.
